definition: to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to ascend in light steps
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
once it gets started there's no stopping it
pinyin: yi1 fa1 bu4 ke3 shou1 shi5

definition: irremediable/unmanageable/out of hand/hopeless
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces

sentences.english: He busied himself by tidying up his desk.
Cleaned out the garage and sold 2 old dehumidifiers on eBay.
sentences.chinese: 收拾了車庫，在易趣上賣掉了兩臺舊除溼機。

sentences.english: When he tidied the room up, he put the odds and ends into a miscellaneous box.
sentences.chinese: 他收拾房間時，把七零八碎的東西全扔進雜物箱。

sentences.english: Even so, many activists say they are packing their bags and heading to Washington.
sentences.chinese: 即便這樣，許多倡導者說他們要收拾行裝上華盛頓。

sentences.english: Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
sentences.chinese: 那些童女就都起來收拾燈。

sentences.english: After we’d finished working, we climbed down and picked up our tools.
sentences.chinese: 幹完活後，我們收拾好工具爬下屋頂。

sentences.english: E. g. I don't know how to straighten the mess out.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道該如何收拾這個爛攤子。

sentences.english: He always afraid I can not clean up after the recall.
sentences.chinese: 他總怕一想起後都無法收拾。

sentences.english: Gold stupa ready to pack up and go home, she doesnt want to let the cattle know victory.
sentences.chinese: 金多寶準備收拾東西回家，她不想讓牛勝利知道。

sentences.english: Yeah. I promise that I'll keep it spick and span.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我保證每天都要把這兒收拾得一塵不染。

sentences.english: I shwhichle amh(clear) up ago dinner nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 當今飯後，我要收拾一下。

sentences.english: She always clears away quickly when we have finished eating.
sentences.chinese: 我們一喫完飯，她總是很快就收拾好餐桌。

sentences.english: Now Lin is helping Jack with the packing.
sentences.chinese: 這會兒小林正幫着傑克收拾行裝。

sentences.english: Tired and sleepy, I went to bed early.
Never clear off your desk by randomly throwing things in a drawer.
sentences.chinese: 不要爲了收拾整頓你的桌子而隨便把東西扔進抽斗裏。

sentences.english: The room is in apple-pie order for our guest.
sentences.chinese: 這房間爲我們的客人收拾得整齊清潔。

definition: to clean/to sweep
to wash the face and rinse the mouth
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
to mess up/to put into disorder/to meddle with/to confuse
to be really busy/pressing business
luggage/CL:件[jian4]
to throw/to throw away
to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
to get up/to leave/to set forth
evening meal/dinner/supper/CL:份[fen4],頓|顿[dun4],次[ci4],餐[can1]
to abandon
chaotic/topsy turvy/a complete mess
old variant of 弄[nong4]
to carry
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
